entry.title: “Seasonal depression and treatment during this time is a...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“Seasonal depression and treatment during this time is a little tricky. Some of the things we would recommend are hindered by COVID-19, especially with the escalating rates. So, things like getting outside might be risky for some people with the transmission of COVID -19, so we’re thinking about some of the basic things to just take care of yourself. What are your coping skills? What are things that do get you involved and happy and excited?" says Dr. Apryl Alexander, a psych...ologist and professor at the University of Denver.

Dr. Alexander says a recent study from the American Psychological Association reports that eight in 10 Americans are feeling stressed because of COVID-19. Even though we're in a pandemic, Dr. Alexander says it's still important to socialize, especially if you are prone to seasonal depression.

"So, how can you maintain those social connections during this time, whether its dance parties we’ve had in our department during COVID-19 to engaging with your family members on Zoom or other forms of social media," says Dr. Alexander.

Dr. Alexander also says many psychologists and therapists are offering virtual sessions, so it's important to take advantage of tele-mental health visits. And with the holiday season approaching, whether you're able to be with family or not, make sure you also take the time to check in on loved ones who may not be feeling themselves this winter season.”

See MoreSocial isolation from the pandemic and any unhealthy habits that might normally form in the winter months could exacerbate seasonal depression.

thedenverchannel.com

Experts concerned about seasonal affective disorder this winter, amid pandemic

Social isolation from the pandemic and any unhealthy habits that might normally form in the winter months could exacerbate seasonal depression.Social isolation from the pandemic and any unhealthy habits that might normally form in the winter months could exacerbate seasonal depression.

entry.title: I have testified against a police officer before this same...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

I have testified against a police officer before this same commission in the past. They listened to our experiences, and the disciplinary actions were upheld. I can only hope they will keep that same energy in a case dealing with far more dehumanizing behavior than what I experienced.

We all know these officers deserve worse than simply the loss of their jobs.

Call and Email the Aurora Civil Service Commission today and let them know that. Tell them we are not safe with peopl...e who think the brutal murder of #ElijahMcClain is a laughing matter terrorizing OUR streets without impunity. Demand that they uphold the disciplinary action taken, because we will not settle for less.

(303) 326-8931
civilservice@auroragov.org￼

No justice, No peace,
-Ari
#JusticeForElijahMcClain #ElijahCriedPower #DefundThePolice #DefendBlackLives

See More

entry.title: On this #TransgenderDayOfRemembrance, remember that our trans...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

On this #TransgenderDayOfRemembrance, remember that our trans and nb siblings are #MoreThanaNumber

The Marsha P. Johnson Institute

“To be remembered by those left behind is to live forever.”

We celebrate BLACK trans people, our lives and full experience today. And everyday.

Last year we wan...ted to shift the focus from numbers to names. And this year, we want to continue to disrupt the idea that BLACK trans people only count in death. Our lives are more than a trending topic in the media more than a hashtag on social media, more than a talking point on the morning news and more than a number. At the start of each year, a countdown begins on the number of murdered trans people leading up to #TransgenderDayofRemembrance with little to no regard for our names. We here at MPJI are shifting the narrative. Don’t call us a number. We have names. We have lives. Honor them as such.

See More

entry.title: Peace to all these beautiful souls and all trans and nb siblings...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Peace to all these beautiful souls and all trans and nb siblings we’ve lost on this day of remembrance.

If you find yourself struggling today please take care of yourself. Trans Lifeline provides peer support for the trans and nb community that’s been divested from police since day one. Run by and for trans people. 1 (877) 565- 8860

Locally, Queer Asterisk provides queer-informed counseling services, educational trainings, and community programming. 720-507-6161...
info@queerasterisk.com

#BlackTransLivesMatter #BlackNBLivesMatter #TransgenderDayOfRemembrance #AllBlackLivesMatter

https://www.google.com/…/transgender-day-of-remembrance-20…/

See MoreIt's the deadliest year on record for the trans community.

elle.com

The Names You Should Know on Transgender Day of Remembrance 2020

#DEMANDS
Immediately fire and revoke the pensions of the officers that murdered Breonna.
Divest from LMPD and Invest in community building
Immediate resignation (or impeachment) of Mayor Greg Fisher
Metro Council ends use of force by Louisville Metro Police Department.
Police shootings are gun violence.
A local, civilian community police accountability council that is independent from the Mayor’s Office and LMPD with investigation and discipline power #CPAC.
The creation of policy to ensure transparent investigation processes
#JusticeforBre #SayHerName
#DefundPolice #DefendBlackLife #KeepGoing #BlackLivesMatterLouisville #JusticeForBreonnaTaylor #InvestDivest

entry.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
